definition: Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
scholar/Confucian

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
Confucian thoughts/the thinking of the Confucian school
New Confucianism, a social and political movement founded in 1920s China that combines aspects of Western and Eastern philosophy/see also 當代新儒家|当代新儒家[Dang1 dai4 Xin1 Ru2 jia1]
Modern New Confucianism/see also 新儒家[Xin1 Ru2 jia1]
Contemporary New Confucianism/see 新儒家[Xin1 Ru2 jia1]

sentences.english: Three generations of hereditary patriarchal system is rather profound social basis of Confucian culture.
sentences.chinese: 三代遺傳的宗法制度毋寧是儒家文化的深厚社會基礎。

sentences.english: Of long standing, Confucianism is the core of Chinese Culture.
sentences.chinese: 儒家思想淵遠流長，構成中國民族文化的核心。

sentences.english: Second, the paper scrutinizes the Confucianists ideas in the way of the Marxism outlook .
sentences.chinese: 第二部分主要是用馬克思主義觀點審視儒家德治思想。

sentences.english: In Beijing, the Education Ministry has approved more courses in traditional Confucian culture.
sentences.chinese: 在北京，教育部批准增加更多與儒家文化相關的課程。

sentences.english: The mean is an important intension of the Confucian school.
sentences.chinese: 中庸是儒家思想中的一個重要內容。

sentences.english: Confucius as the founder of the Confucianism is inside and outside double in the culture method.
sentences.chinese: 作爲儒家創始人的孔子，在修養方法上是仁禮互重。

sentences.english: Therefore, we can say that Confucian culture has a long history and tradition in Singapore.
sentences.chinese: 因而可以說，儒家文化在新加坡有着悠久的歷史傳統。

sentences.english: Human nature is an important constituent of the Confucianism.
sentences.chinese: 人性論是儒家思想的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: Discussion on justice of the mean by Confucius;
sentences.chinese: 中庸是儒家思想的一個重要組成部分。

sentences.english: Confucianism, the bore Qiu initiated the lofty spirit of morals docile.
sentences.chinese: 儒家，孔丘倡導了道德善良的崇高精神。

sentences.english: Benevolence was an important Confucian advocacy in ruling states.
sentences.chinese: “仁政”是儒家治國的一項重要主張。

sentences.english: This is referred to as the Confucian Road "music rituals" of the theme.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲儒家所稱道的“制禮作樂”的主題思想。

sentences.english: The highest good theory of Master Yangming belongs to the human nature theory of Confucian school.
sentences.chinese: 陽明子的至善論本來屬於儒家人性論的話題。

sentences.english: China’s Confucian tradition places strong emphasis on the obligation to care for parents.
sentences.chinese: 中國儒家文化特別重視贍養父母的義務。

sentences.english: These two themes can respectively represent Confucian and Taoist ideal of life.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個主題可以分別代表儒家和道家的生活理想。

sentences.english: The Confucian Civilization is a geopolitical phrase in the world.
sentences.chinese: 儒家文明是一個世界地緣政治的摹狀詞。

definition: Confucianism
Confucian thoughts/the thinking of the Confucian school
Confucianism
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
Confucius and Mencius
Confucian

Legalist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] and Li Si 李斯[Li3 Si1], later adopted by Shang Yang 商鞅[Shang1 Yang1] whose reforms helped establish the supremacy of the Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin1 dai4] (221-207 BC)
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
study of the Confucian classics
Dong Zhongshu (179-104 BC), philosopher influential in establishing Confucianism as the established system of values of former Han dynasty
dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucians (slogan of the Former Han dynasty)
the Hundred Schools of Thought, the various schools of thought and their exponents during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (770-220 BC)
Xun Zi or Hsun Tzu (c. 310-237 BC), Confucian philosopher and author of On learning 勸學|劝学
